intro: Euphrasia scottica, commonly known as Scottish eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Scottish Highlands. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and heathlands. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Euphrasia scottica is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a rare and delicate species.
